result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for a pretrial conference 12/2/22 at 11:30 A.M. and return date 1/10/23 at 10:00 A.M.

9:27 AM Defendant Amanda Ann Meltesen in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to atty recited, Defendant would like counsel, defendant to contact the Public Defender's Office, Court in recess at 9:29 A.M., Case recalled at 9:36 A.M., appearances the same, defendant does qualify for Public Defender, matter to be reset,
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return date scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Pre- trial 10/7/22 at 10:30 AM
Return date 10/20/22 at 9:00 AM
Standard felony conditions, not leave the State of WI without written permission of the court, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia.

1:17 PM Defendant Amanda Ann Meltesen appeared by video, in custody from Columbia County jail.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim appeared by video for Amanda Ann Meltesen.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. waived reading of criminal complaint, right to attorney recited, $500.00 signature bond, standard felony conditions, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. not leave the State of WI without written permission of the court, waived time limits for preliminary hearing 1:29 PM
